title: Make the UI more colorful across the storefront and portals

requirements.text: Increase overall UI colorfulness across the app (storefront, customer, vendor, admin) by applying more intentional use of the existing theme palette (primary orange/yellow, secondary blue, accent green) in key surfaces and highlights (headers/nav, section headers, cards, chips/badges, focus states, and empty states) while keeping readability and contrast strong in both light and dark modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Across Home, Categories, Product, Cart, Checkout, and the Admin/Vendor dashboards, visible accent color usage is increased beyond just the primary CTA buttons (e.g., colored section headers, chips, badges, and subtle tinted card backgrounds).
Text remains readable: no primary/secondary/accent-colored backgrounds have low-contrast foreground text in either light or dark mode.
No shadcn/ui immutable component source files are modified.

requirements.text: Enhance visual richness by adding subtle color gradients and tinted backgrounds using existing Tailwind theme tokens (e.g., soft primary/secondary/accent tints on hero overlays, category tiles, and key callout cards) and update hover/active states to feel more vibrant without reducing usability.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero/banner areas and category cards show subtle, tasteful color treatment (tints/gradients) that is consistent with the existing palette.
Interactive elements (nav links, cards, product tiles, buttons) have clearer, more colorful hover/focus states than before.
The UI does not become visually noisy: spacing and hierarchy remain clear and consistent.

requirements.text: Make data/status elements more colorful and informative by applying consistent, palette-aligned styling to badges and status indicators (e.g., order status pills, stock/availability, success/error/info states) across customer/vendor/admin pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Order status badges/pills use distinct, consistent colors aligned to the theme (e.g., accent/success green, secondary blue, destructive, muted) and are readable.
The same status value appears with the same styling anywhere it is rendered (customer orders, vendor orders, admin orders).

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text that changes as part of this work.
Do not edit any files under the immutable shadcn/ui component sources (frontend/src/components/ui).
Stay within the already-defined palette (primary orange/yellow, secondary blue, accent green) and keep strong contrast in light and dark modes.
nonGoals: No backend schema or Motoko logic changes.
No new pages or new product features beyond visual/theme enhancements.
